llm.feedback: Add the current DXY level (≈96.5) and note that if it exceeds 96.5 the trade‑risk premium collapses (Z7O1DCHS7). Tighten the causal chain by linking CPI > 2.6 % to a 30 % probability of a Fed cut and a 0.5‑1.0 % upside for DXY (3YAQ8JUPL). Include numeric ranges for risk scenarios: Fed cut → DXY ↓ 0.5‑1.0 % (U21K4ALYQ), tech earnings rebound → DXY ↓ 0.3‑0.6 % (FAN5RYW6T), Ukraine war resolution → DXY ↓ 0.4‑0.7 % (XTQIQRP5K), tariff expansion → DXY ↑ 0.2‑0.5 % (F7K7Y35U5), tariff rollback → DXY ↓ 0.2‑0.4 % (F7K7Y35U5). Remove the redundant “risk‑premium collapse” phrasing and consolidate each sentence to a single causal link with inline citation. Keep the view in 5 concise sentences, each containing the handle mapping (DXY), a catalyst window (Aug 12 CPI, Sept Fed meeting, late‑Aug tariffs, Q3 earnings), and the explicit magnitude range.
